prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Practical Advice for Protecting Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: The purpose of this chapter has been to provide practical advice for businesses seeking to protect their confidential information. A brief outline has been given of practices that will assist in the preservation of confidentiality and also increase the likelihood that information will receive legal protection from the courts. Of course, each of these guidelines must be adapted to meet the needs of the relevant business or industry.

While most companies will not need, or be able to afford, to implement all of the ideas presented in this chapter, each business will benefit from a review of the suggestions and a consideration of the steps that can be taken to protect business assets. In the information economy, companies must recognize that their success increasingly depends on intellectual capital such as ideas, knowledge, skills and technological innovation. Most significant, that capital, whether in the form of individual skills, organizational abilities or customer connections, is intimately connected with an employer's employees. Accordingly, both the practical and the legal issues discussed in this text are of paramount importance to businesses seeking to thrive in the modern economy.
